title: Boston Healthcare for the Homeless Program laying off 25 in anticipation of Medicaid cuts
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News Healthcare workers planned to rally before BHCHP’s headquarters in Boston’s South End.

Tachick, a nurse with the Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program, left kneeling, and Jim Greene, Assistant Director for Street Homelessness Initiatives, Mayor’s Office of Housing, City of Boston, right standing, conduct welfare checks at the Temple Place MBTA Station in Boston.
Brett Phelps for The Boston Globe Facing looming Medicaid cuts, the Boston Health Care for the Homeless Program is laying off staff and shutting down a medical respite facility in Jamaica Plain.

title: Boston pays $150K to two men wrongfully tied to Carol Stuart murder
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News After a pregnant woman was shot in 1989, two Black men, Willie Bennett and Alan Swanson, were arrested amid a major manhunt.
Mayor Michelle Wu and Alan Swanson arrive for a press conference and public apology to Swanson and Willie Bennett at City Hall in Boston on Dec.

title: Conn. youth football coach arrested after allegedly pushing 7-year-old player to the ground
author: Madison Lucchesi
bullets: Crime The coach was also fired.
Daniel Fazio.
New Milford Police Department A youth football coach in Connecticut was arrested after allegedly pushing a 7-year-old player to the ground on Sunday.

title: Jayson Tatum isn’t ruling out playing this season: ‘I’m not working out six days a week for no reason’

title: Tom Brady refutes Dave Portnoy’s report of $75 million flag football payday
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots "While we’re breaking news.
Elvis is doing the halftime show," Brady wrote.

title: Priest who taught at BC High found not guilty of child rape
author: Ross Cristantiello
bullets: Local News Kevin White was accused of assaulting a student while teaching at BC High in 2008 and 2009.
His lawyer said the allegations were "fabricated.
" Kevin White, a Jesuit priest and former teacher at Boston College High School, in court during his rape trial.

title: Review & setlist: Elvis Costello was tender, tired, and ultimately triumphant at MGM Music Hall
author: Peter Chianca
bullets: Concert Reviews Costello focused on his early songs, stumbling over a few but for the most part delivering them in roaring fashion.
Elvis Costello, here at Madison Square Garden in 2023, brought his "Radio Soul" tour to MGM Music Hall on Monday.
Myrna M.
